Chapter.Title: Practice Exercise 2-9: Using the input function
Chapter.Data:
Write a program that uses the function input to prompt the user to enter a number and read it into a variable called num. The program adds 2 to the value stored in num, multiplies the resulting value by 10, then subtracts 13 and prints out the result. Note: The input function returns the number as text instead of a numeric value. You can convert it to a floating-point number by using a built-in function called float spelled as f l o a t: float(num)
Now you can perform arithmetic operations such as float(num)+2
